TopicTitle: Look at this plane that can take off with no thrust, fly, and land.

Articles.Content:
Simple, haven't seen any of these yet. Torquing effects at its finest to make a plane lift off and fly with stock parts.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKCk4XMuwjs

I made this.

yeah infinigliders are fun to mess around with

Edited May 19, 2013 by Dasemay
Its an old bug known as infiniglide.
I've never seen an infiniglider that can get off the ground with no thrust.

skimmed through your video and stopped at the velocity part.

click on the velocity itll change it to surface velocity. if you have a target selected with more clicks itll change it to target velocity (essential for docking). these types of readouts change automatically so you dont normally need to manually change them.

and yes, you are orbiting that quickly. Ill leave it to you to figure out why your velocity relative to orbit is rather high, while your velocity relative to the ground is rather low.

I just love when things like canards break off and then flutter off like mechanical butterflies... flap, flap, flap....

Oh for the age of KSP new physics version. We will have to relearn how to fly and have aerodynamic payloads finally... YAY.

It will be a shock when the aerodynamics are fixed; I'll have to add actual fairings to my rockets, and that means no more launching small space stations in one go for me But we'll get fairings, which look mega cool!
